data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهِ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
The word وَمَا comes from the root م ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word كُنْتُمْ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
The word إِنْ comes from the root ا ن and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: Be possessed of good, to do good, give one a choice or option (and also be given a choice or option), prefer one thing or person over another thing or person, preferred/pronounced/chosen, strive to surpass one in goodness, excellent in beauty and disposition, to be ideal (show actual or potential usefulness or benefit), be desired in all circumstances and by every person, exalted in rank or quality or reputation, to be better than another person or thing, be the best of things or people, to be generous (possess and show generosity), possess nobility or eminence, be elevated in state or condition.
data.sentence: The word خَيْرٌ comes from the root خ ي ر and is associated with the meanings: Be possessed of good, to do good, give one a choice or option (and also be given a choice or option), prefer one thing or person over another thing or person, preferred/pronounced/chosen, strive to surpass one in goodness, excellent in beauty and disposition, to be ideal (show actual or potential usefulness or benefit), be desired in all circumstances and by every person, exalted in rank or quality or reputation, to be better than another person or thing, be the best of things or people, to be generous (possess and show generosity), possess nobility or eminence, be elevated in state or condition.

data.meanings: become/feel safe/secure, state of security/safety, trust, become quiet/tranquil in heart/mind, become free of expectation of evil or free of an object of dislike/hatred, promise/assurance of security/safety, become trustful/faithful/confident, to believe/acknowledge it, manifestation of humility/submission
data.sentence: The word مُؤْمِنِينَ comes from the root ا م ن and is associated with the meanings: become/feel safe/secure, state of security/safety, trust, become quiet/tranquil in heart/mind, become free of expectation of evil or free of an object of dislike/hatred, promise/assurance of security/safety, become trustful/faithful/confident, to believe/acknowledge it, manifestation of humility/submission
The word أَنَا comes from the root ا ن ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: To guard, protect, take care of, watch, put in store, preserve, learn by heart.
data.sentence: The word بِحَفِيظٍ comes from the root ح ف ظ and is associated with the meanings: To guard, protect, take care of, watch, put in store, preserve, learn by heart.

data.meanings: Something or someone that remains, continues, lasts and/or enduresPerpetual or permanentExisting, incessantly, always, endlessly or foreverWatching, observing, guarding or preservingPardoning, leaving, showing mercy or sparingRemaining portion, remainder, remnant, relic, residue, remains, recompense
data.sentence: The word بَقِيَّتُ comes from the root ب ق ي and is associated with the meanings: Something or someone that remains, continues, lasts and/or enduresPerpetual or permanentExisting, incessantly, always, endlessly or foreverWatching, observing, guarding or preservingPardoning, leaving, showing mercy or sparingRemaining portion, remainder, remnant, relic, residue, remains, recompense
